SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.form

Class AsyncRule

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.form.AsyncRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Rule
public class AsyncRule extends Object implements Rule
A specialized Rule that supports asynchronous validation via CompletableFuture. This is useful for checks that require non-blocking operations, such as calling remote services or performing database queries.

Unlike regular rules, the actual validation occurs in validateAsync(String). The synchronous validate(String) method always returns true, effectively doing nothing. The Form.verifyAsync(String[]) method is responsible for invoking validateAsync on all AsyncRule instances.

Usage Example: 


 AsyncRule rule = new AsyncRule(
         value -> {
             // Pretend this is a remote call
             return someRemoteService.checkValueAsync(value);
         },
         "Value was rejected by remote service.");
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Beaudin

    • AsyncRule

      public AsyncRule(Function<String,CompletableFuture<Boolean>> asyncValidator, String errorMessage)
      Constructs a new AsyncRule with the provided async validator function and error message.
      Parameters:
      asyncValidator - A function that takes a string value and returns a CompletableFuture<Boolean> indicating if the value is valid.
      errorMessage - The error message displayed if validation fails.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      public boolean validate(String data)
      A no-op for synchronous checks, always returning true. Asynchronous validation is delegated to validateAsync(String).
      Specified by:
      validate in interface Rule
      Parameters:
      data - The field value to validate (unused).
      Returns:
      Always true.

    • validateAsync

      public CompletableFuture<Boolean> validateAsync(String data)
      Performs the actual asynchronous validation for this rule.
      Parameters:
      data - The field value to validate.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if valid, or false otherwise.

    • getErrorMessage

      public String getErrorMessage()
      Returns the error message for this rule, used if validateAsync completes with false.
